decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence while using instant removal and control spells like Fatal Push and Force of Negation to protect the combo. The deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to bring back big threats from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells, creating a fast and aggressive game plan that can catch opponents off guard and dominate the battlefield.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while also utilizing Leyline of the Guildpact and Tribal Flames to deal additional damage. The inclusion of Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco adds a powerful late-game threat to finish off the opponent. Stubborn Denial provides protection against removal spells, while Leyline Binding helps control the board. The mana base is optimized for consistent color access to cast spells efficiently. Overall, this deck aims to apply relentless pressure and close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy with a combination of creature aggression and burn spells. It aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while also utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge for additional damage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Thraben Charm to control the board and protect its threats. Additionally, the deck has some card advantage and recursion with cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Seasoned Pyromancer.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation, hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize, and removal spells such as Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to win the game. The inclusion of card draw spells like Preordain and powerful finishers like Consign to Memory helps to maintain card advantage and close out the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through various removal spells, counterspells, and disruptive creatures. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Gifts Ungiven and Ephemerate, while also efficiently dealing with threats using cards like Prismatic Ending and Solitude. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler to help stabilize the board and control the game. With a mix of versatile spells and efficient threats, this deck aims to control the game and outlast the opponent until it can secure a victory.

This deck focuses on a high-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing a variety of multicolor creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By efficiently using mana fixing cards like Tribal Flames and Leyline of the Guildpact, the deck is able to consistently hit the opponent with powerful creatures like Cecil, Dark Knight and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Thoughtseize and Leyline Binding provide disruption and control, while Lightning Bolt offers additional direct damage. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support its multicolor requirements and maximize its aggressive potential.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with disruptive abilities and aggressive power to control the board and pressure the opponent. By combining cards that allow for removal, hand disruption, and creature manipulation, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while steadily building up its own board presence. The key strategy is to apply early pressure with efficient creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while quickly putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Force of Negation and Sink into Stupor, the deck aims to control the game and limit the opponent's options. Cards like Shardless Agent and Ice-Fang Coatl provide card advantage and flexibility, allowing the deck to maintain pressure while disrupting the opponent's board. With a mix of removal, disruption, and aggression, this deck looks to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Solitude. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Ephemerate and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to win by overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and disrupting their game plan before they can react effectively. The key strategy revolves around combining reanimation effects with control elements to create a powerful and efficient combo deck.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards that can cycle through your library quickly and efficiently, such as Street Wraith and Shardless Agent, to quickly fill your graveyard with creatures. Once your graveyard is stocked, you can use the powerful spell Living End to bring all those creatures back onto the battlefield, overwhelming your opponent with a massive board presence. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety to control the game while you set up the combo. Overall, the strategy revolves around cheating creatures into play from the graveyard for a devastating surprise attack.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. Utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to apply early pressure, backed up by cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for additional support and resilience. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to seal the deal. The land base is carefully crafted to support the mana requirements of the deck, while cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison provide additional utility and disruption to opponents' strategies.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes while drawing cards and generating value with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nulldrifter. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Wrath of the Skies and Solitude, and eventually win the game with powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures and spells to control the opponent's board while gradually chipping away at their life total with aggressive creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while deploying powerful threats like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk. The deck also utilizes flicker effects to generate additional value from creatures like Flickerwisp and Witch Enchanter. Overall, the deck combines elements of aggression and disruption to control the game and secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while also using powerful spells such as Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to control the board. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional value by buffing creatures and dealing damage. Additionally, cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison can help finish off opponents or disrupt their game plan. Overall, this Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

This Modern Aggro - Affinity deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch to recur them from the graveyard. By ramping up mana with Mox Amber and Mox Opal, the deck can play multiple spells in a turn and overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt. With Urza's Saga providing additional value and card advantage, the deck aims to close out games swiftly by leveraging its artifact synergy and explosive plays.

The main focus of the deck is to use Lantern of Insight along with Codex Shredder and other control tools to lock down the opponent's draws and prevent them from making any meaningful plays. The deck also utilizes cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Blood Moon to limit the opponent's threats and synergizes with Urza's Saga to generate additional value. The inclusion of cards like The Underworld Cookbook, The Meathook Massacre, and The Mycosynth Gardens provide additional utility and ways to close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to control the opponent's resources and win through attrition.
